title: Innovation Manager in the Field of Gastrointestinal Biomarker and Target Discovery
field: Bioengineering, Biomedical Engineering, Biomedicine, Gastroenterology, Genetics, and 2 moreMolecular Medicine,Pharmacy & Pharmacology
job_description: (ref. OZK-2022-3)IBS (irritable bowel syndrome) and IBD (inflammatory bowel diseases) are multifactorial chronic immune-mediated disorders of the gut. Due to the heterogeneity of these patient populations, treatment remains unsatisfactory and begs for groundbreaking improvements. The GUTFIRE consortium aims to identify novel therapeutic targets and prognostic and therapeutic biomarkers to discover new treatments and develop personalized regimens respectively. The Innovation Manager will mainly focus on substantially increasing the valorization output by 1) enhancing the visibility and outreach activities of GUTFIRE towards industrial partners, 2) detecting potential valorization opportunities and implement a customized valorization strategy, and 3) by attracting additional funding, mainly but not solely focusing on the Health Programme of Horizon Europe. The goal of Industrial Research Fund (lOF) at KU Leuven, is to accelerate the transfer of knowledge and innovations arising from strategic basic research to the market. A team of more than 40 experienced Innovation Managers, embedded within research groups throughout the University and University Hospital, achieve this goal primarily by establishing mutually beneficial, collaborative relationships with a broad range of external partners in industry, academia, as well as national and regional public-private organizations.Website unitResponsibilitiesYou will manage the innovation/exploitation of the patent portfolio and novel discoveries of the GUTFIRE consortium and interact proactively with the pharmaceutical industry and biotech companies in Flanders or outside. You will also be responsible for the scouting and acquisition of EU and national projects with high economic finality.Your responsibilities include:- To attract additional funding for the consortium by pro-actively screening Research and Industrial Institutes & Organizations for funding opportunities, by identifying and following up on leads for consortium building, by participating in the writing of grant proposals, mainly but not solely focusing on the Health Programme of Horizon Europe.- To follow up on the scientific results of the running projects, detect potential valorization opportunities early in the course of the projects and implement proper development roadmaps.- To protect the generated results, analyze their freedom-to-operate for commercialization and develop and implement a customized valorization strategy. Every project should have a clear planning of the valorization possibilities from the start of the project.- To manage new and ongoing research projects within the GUTFIRE consortium with a clear valorisation track.- To enhance the visibility and outreach activities of the GUTFIRE consortium with a special emphasis on expanding the network of industrial partners and/or prolonging existing industrial contracts.- To support term sheet negotiations and contracting in collaboration with KU Leuven R&D.- To establish an industrial ecosystem and monitor the industry trends in the field.The Innovation Manager will coordinate the valorization program through regular meetings and inform the Management Board of achieved milestones.Profile- PhD or minimum 5 years of research experience in biomedical sciences, bio-engineering, pharmaceutical sciences.- General background in biomedical research with a good knowledge of molecular techniques such as (but not restricted to) genetics, transcriptomics, metagenomics, proteomics, metabolomics, flow cytometry, but also a good knowledge of biomarker discovery, therapeutic target validation and early stage drug development.- General background knowledge in drug development and biomarker validation/assay development and related regulations.- An entrepreneurial mindset with a first experience in business development and valorization activities. A working knowledge of contracts and intellectual property rights would be a plus.- Proven track record of project proposal writing and good knowledge of the national and international funding landscape.- Good knowledge of the field of gastroenterology, ideally have background knowledge of IBD and IBS.- Experience in networking with pharma and government institutions.- Knowledge about ethics, privacy (e.g. GDPR), and data management.- Good communicator, team player and networker.- Innovative thinker with an eye for building connections between academia and industry.- Excellent knowledge of Dutch and English, in speaking and writing.OfferAn exciting and challenging job, focused on continuous innovation and development in a transdisciplinary and international context.
